dcterms:creator: A. Shahroudy
J. Liu
T.-T. Ng
G. Wang
dcterms:description: NTU RGB+D is currently the most widely used and the largest multi-modality indoor-captured action recognition dataset. It includes RGB videos, depth sequences, infrared videos, and 3D skeleton data captured by the Microsoft Kinect v2 camera, covering 60 human action classes.
dcterms:title: NTU RGB+D

dcterms:description: Kinetics-Skeleton is based on the Kinetics dataset, which includes approximately 300,000 video clips collected from YouTube. The dataset covers 400 kinds of human actions and includes estimated 2D joint locations for each frame.
dcterms:title: Kinetics-Skeleton
